contact.name: Gazprom
contact.note: Core details from LinkedIn page; no public email or phone listed on LinkedIn or the official website.

info.name: Gazprom
info.size: $117.4 billion revenue (2022), 359 bcm natural gas produced (2023)
info.specialization: State-owned integrated natural gas company; exploration, production, processing, distribution, and export (especially via pipelines). Operates the Unified Gas Supply System (UGSS), controls most of Russia's production and domestic gas transmission.
info.note: Gazprom is the dominant player in Russia’s natural gas distribution both domestically and for export, with a near monopoly on pipeline exports.[1][2][3][4][5]

contact.name: NOVATEK
contact.note: LinkedIn and website verified. No public phone/email on LinkedIn; official site provides contact but omitted per rules.

info.name: Novatek
info.specialization: Russia’s largest independent natural gas producer, specializing in exploration, production, and processing with major focus on liquefied natural gas (LNG) for export.
info.note: Novatek is the leading Russian private LNG producer, competing internationally and supplying both domestic and global customers.[1][2][3][4]

contact.name: PJSC Rosneft Oil Company
contact.note: Name, website, and contact matched on LinkedIn and official site; public email and phone from Rosneft.com; LinkedIn link verified.

info.name: Rosneft
info.size: $111.1 billion revenue (2022), approx. 69-93 bcm natural gas produced (2023)
info.specialization: Integrated oil & gas company with significant natural gas exploration and production; supplies to industrial and utility clients, including major contracts with Inter RAO.
info.note: Rosneft is primarily an oil company but is one of Russia's three largest natural gas producers. More focused on upstream production than distribution or retail. Supplies large-scale gas to energy utilities.[1][3][4]
